Find tech experiences around you

  • !!!!!!

    Programming and Linguistics Research Opportunity

    Details

    !!!Interdisciplinary Affective Science Laboratory at NEU

    The Interdisciplinary Affective Science Laboratory is looking for someone with programming experience who can help develop a custom GUI to collect experimental data on word similarity. Contact Katie Hoemann at khoemann@gmail.com.

  • Mar2

    WECode

    Register

    March 2nd - 4th, 2018Harvard University

    WECode is an annual student-run Women in Computer Science conference hosted at Harvard. The deadline for financial aid applications is February 10th.

  • Mar5

    Husky Treks (Google, Education First, Boston Children's Hospital, etc)

    Read more

    March 5th - 9th, 2018Various Boston companies

    Husky Treks take place at some of Boston's top companies for you to explore different career paths. Applications are due February 19th.

  • Mar18

    NEScala

    Find out more

    March 18th - 20th, 2018Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard

    NEScala is an annual conference for Scala developers held in conjunction with Boston's Typelevel Summit. Stay tuned for info about free tickets.

  • Mar21

    Bezinga Women's Wealth Forum

    Get your ticket

    March 21st, 2018State Room, Boston

    For those who are interested in a financial tech career, use the code NEU for a free ticket to the Bezinga fintech job fair.

  • Apr1

    Women in Computing Scholarship

    Apply

    April 1st, 2018

    Dotcom-Moniter is now accepting applications for women pursuing a career in computing to earn a $1000 scholarship.
